meanings.definition: A flat, open area outside a building, typically paved and used for dining or recreation.
meanings.sent1: We enjoyed our lunch on the terrasse overlooking the garden.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant had a lovely terrasse where people could sit and relax.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels thought the terrasse was a perfect spot for a picnic.
meanings.sent4: The terrasse stretched out like a welcoming hand, inviting us to unwind.
meanings.sent5: The terrasse was bathed in sunlight, making it a delightful place to spend the afternoon.

meanings.definition: To provide with a terrace or terraces.
meanings.sent1: The hotel will terrasse the rooftop for guests to enjoy the view.
meanings.sent2: They decided to terrasse the backyard to create a cozy outdoor space.
meanings.sent3: The chef wanted to terrasse the kitchen with fresh herbs for cooking.
meanings.sent4: The gardener will terrasse the garden with colorful flowers.
meanings.sent5: The construction team will terrasse the office building with a rooftop garden.

meanings.definition: A row of houses built in a similar style.
meanings.sent1: The terrasse of townhouses looked charming with their matching facades.
meanings.sent2: The terrasse of cottages along the river created a picturesque scene.
meanings.sent3: The terrasse of bungalows seemed to be having a neighborhood party.
meanings.sent4: The terrasse of villas stood proudly in a line, each unique yet harmonious.
meanings.sent5: The terrasse of cabins nestled in the woods gave a sense of unity and community.
